UI: Content Card

Content Card

The Content Card is a generic, flexible component for displaying content without type-specific data properties. It renders all common card fields: media (images, videos), headlines, subheadlines, summary, body text, authors, engagement metrics, tags, links, and actions. Uses Schema.org/CreativeWork markup as a generic content type.

Generic Content Card For flexible content display

Content Team Editorial

The Content Card is a versatile component that renders all common fields without type-specific data. Use it for simple content that doesn't fit a specific card type.

This card demonstrates the base content structure shared by all card types. It includes media, headlines, summary text, author attribution, engagement metrics, tags, and action buttons.

Text-Only Example

Text-Only Content Card

This example shows a content card with no media - just pure text content. Perfect for quotes, announcements, or simple text blocks.

The content card adapts gracefully when media is not provided. It focuses on the textual content while maintaining proper semantic structure and optional Schema.org markup.

Use this approach when visuals aren't necessary or when you want to draw attention to the written content.
